newsitem.title: SWEDEN: RALLYING-ERIKSSON TAKES LEAD IN SWEDISH RALLY.
newsitem.headline: RALLYING-ERIKSSON TAKES LEAD IN SWEDISH RALLY.

text.p: Swede Kenneth Eriksson made the most of his local knowledge to take a seven-second lead after the fifth stage of the Swedish Rally in Fredriksberg on Saturday.

The Subaru driver took the lead at the end of the fourth stage and maintained his advantage to lead reigning world champion Tommi Makinen of Finland, in a Mitsubishi, and Spaniard Carlos Sainz, in a Ford.
"I am full of confidence and very happy with how things are going," said Eriksson.
"Everything is coming together well now and, although the mild weather means gravel is coming through the snow, there is a consistent level of grip."
Sainz lies another two seconds behind despite a spin on the second stage which caused slight damage to the rear of his Escort car.
Finn Jarno Kytolehto, who set the third best time on Friday's opening stage in his Ford, retired during the fourth stage with engine problems.
The afternoon's four stages through east Sweden will take to the teams to their overnight stop in Borlange.
